intro: Funckia spicata, commonly known as the spicata funckia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaryllidaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces dense clusters of white or pale yellow blossoms, which are often fragrant. Funckia spicata typically grows from bulbs and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and containers due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
